edu.rit.pj2

Class Backend

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.Backend
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BackendRef

    public class Backend
extends Object
implements BackendRef
    Class Backend provides an object and main program that runs a Task on a certain node of a cluster. The Backend prints log messages on the Launcher's standard output.

    Usage: java edu.rit.pj2.Backend name jobID taskID jobHost jobPort

    Note: The Backend constructs an instance of the task's class using the class's no-argument constructor, with access checks suppressed. This means the task's class and/or the task's no-argument constructor need not be public, and a new instance will still be constructed. However, this also requires that either (a) a security manager is not installed, or (b) the security manager allows ReflectPermission("suppressAccessChecks"). See the java.lang.reflect.Constructor.setAccessible() method for further information.
